title: Rome IV Diagnostic Criteria for Child Cyclic Vomiting Syndrome
desc: The Rome IV Criteria for Child Cyclic Vomiting Syndrome provides criteria for diagnosis of child cyclic vomiting syndrome.

orgreference.text: Hyams J, Di lorenzo C, Forbes D, et al. Childhood functional gastrointestinal disorders: child/adolescent. Gastroenterology. 2006;130(5):1527-37.

data.evidence:
To fulfill the Rome IV criteria for child cyclic vomiting syndrome, patient must have the following:

  1. The occurrence of ≥2 periods of intense, unremitting nausea and paroxysmal vomiting, lasting hours to days within a 6-month period.
  2. Episodes are stereotypical in each patient.
  3. Episodes are separated by weeks to months with return to baseline health between episodes.
  4. After appropriate medical evaluation, the symptoms cannot be attributed to another condition.
